answers.answer: Hello,Common causes causing erection problem are stress and anxiety,poor communication with your partner, unrealistic sexual expectations, which make sex a task rather than a pleasure,negative feelings about non performance,smoking, alcohol and sometimes illicit drugs and medical conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, heart or thyroid conditions, poor circulation, low testosterone, depression, spinal cord injury, nerve damage (for example, from prostate surgery), or neurologic disorders (such as multiple sclerosis or Parkinson's disease).In this case the damage to the nerve is the primary cause and diabetes and hypertension causing the secondary causes.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Patient was injured almost 2 years ago and initialy had C1 cord edema and SAH.   Seems to be no lasting effects from the SCI and TBI.  He is a diabetic w Hgb A1-C at 7.8.  Hypertension and medication controlled.   1 year prior to this injury he saw a urologist for ED most likely related to these conditions and had an enlarged prostate and low normal testosterone.  Now, his urologist he has returned back to says he has a pathologic bulbocavernosus reflex with no damping of the reflex indicating an upper tract injury contributing to neurologic impotence.  He does not feel in any way related to the pre-injury ED causation or to his comorbids.   Can the resolved C1 cord edema be the cause of his ED almost 2 years out from injury?
title: ED and C1 cord edema
